I think that the length of a unit test is not the deciding factor, or shoul=
dn't be. I have written unit tests that range from a half dozen lines to tw=
o dozen lines. The shorter tests were for more easily tested things while t=
he longer tests were for the more complicated test setups.

Assuming that y=
ou have factored out any duplicate environment setup code, then just accept=
 that some tests will be longer than others. My criteria as to whether it i=
s a good test is whether it truely helps me find bugs in my code.
